viz_type.label: Visualization Type
viz_type.description: The type of visualization to display

metrics.label: Metrics
metrics.description: One or many metrics to display

percent_metrics.label: Percentage Metrics
percent_metrics.description: Metrics for which percentage of total are to be displayed

y_axis_bounds.label: Y Axis Bounds
y_axis_bounds.description: Bounds for the Y-axis. When left empty, the bounds are dynamically defined based on the min/max of the data. Note that this feature will only expand the axis range. It won't narrow the data's extent.

order_by_cols.label: Ordering
order_by_cols.description: One or many metrics to display

color_picker.label: Fixed Color
color_picker.description: Use this to define a static color for all circles

metric_2.label: Right Axis Metric
metric_2.description: Choose a metric for right axis

normalize_across.label: Normalize Across
normalize_across.description: Color will be rendered based on a ratio of the cell against the sum of across this criteria

horizon_color_scale.label: Horizon Color Scale
horizon_color_scale.description: Defines how the colors are attributed.

canvas_image_rendering.label: Rendering
canvas_image_rendering.description: image-rendering CSS attribute of the canvas object that defines how the browser scales up the image

xscale_interval.label: XScale Interval
xscale_interval.description: Number of steps to take between ticks when displaying the X scale

yscale_interval.label: YScale Interval
yscale_interval.description: Number of steps to take between ticks when displaying the Y scale

include_time.label: Include Time
include_time.description: Whether to include the time granularity as defined in the time section

show_perc.label: Show percentage
show_perc.description: Whether to include the percentage in the tooltip

show_markers.label: Show Markers
show_markers.description: Show data points as circle markers on the lines

show_bar_value.label: Bar Values
show_bar_value.description: Show the value on top of the bar

combine_metric.label: Combine Metrics
combine_metric.description: Display metrics side by side within each column, as opposed to each column being displayed side by side for each metric.

show_controls.label: Extra Controls
show_controls.description: Whether to show extra controls or not. Extra controls include things like making mulitBar charts stacked or side by side.

reduce_x_ticks.label: Reduce X ticks
reduce_x_ticks.description: Reduces the number of X-axis ticks to be rendered. If true, the x-axis won't overflow and labels may be missing. If false, a minimum width will be applied to columns and the width may overflow into a horizontal scroll.

include_series.label: Include Series
include_series.description: Include series name as an axis

secondary_metric.label: Color Metric
secondary_metric.description: A metric to use for color

select_country.label: Country Name
select_country.description: The name of the country that Superset should display

country_fieldtype.label: Country Field Type
country_fieldtype.description: The country code standard that Superset should expect to find in the [country] column

freq.label: Frequency
freq.description:
The periodicity over which to pivot time. Users can provide
      "Pandas" offset alias.
      Click on the info bubble for more details on accepted "freq" expressions.

groupby.label: Group by
groupby.description: One or many controls to group by

columns.label: Columns
columns.description: One or many controls to pivot as columns

druid_time_origin.label: Origin
druid_time_origin.description: Defines the origin where time buckets start, accepts natural dates as in `now`, `sunday` or `1970-01-01`

bottom_margin.label: Bottom Margin
bottom_margin.description: Bottom margin, in pixels, allowing for more room for axis labels

left_margin.label: Left Margin
left_margin.description: Left margin, in pixels, allowing for more room for axis labels

granularity.label: Time Granularity
granularity.description: The time granularity for the visualization. Note that you can type and use simple natural language as in `10 seconds`, `1 day` or `56 weeks`

domain_granularity.label: Domain
domain_granularity.description: The time unit used for the grouping of blocks

subdomain_granularity.label: Subdomain
subdomain_granularity.description: The time unit for each block. Should be a smaller unit than domain_granularity. Should be larger or equal to Time Grain

link_length.label: Link Length
link_length.description: Link length in the force layout

granularity_sqla.label: Time Column
granularity_sqla.description: The time column for the visualization. Note that you can define arbitrary expression that return a DATETIME column in the table. Also note that the filter below is applied against this column or expression

time_grain_sqla.label: Time Grain
time_grain_sqla.description: The time granularity for the visualization. This applies a date transformation to alter your time column and defines a new time granularity. The options here are defined on a per database engine basis in the Superset source code.

whisker_options.label: Whisker/outlier options
whisker_options.description: Determines how whiskers and outliers are calculated.

treemap_ratio.label: Ratio
treemap_ratio.description: Target aspect ratio for treemap tiles.

limit.label: Series limit
limit.description: Limits the number of time series that get displayed

timeseries_limit_metric.label: Sort By
timeseries_limit_metric.description: Metric used to define the top series

order_desc.label: Sort Descending
order_desc.description: Whether to sort descending or ascending

rolling_type.label: Rolling
rolling_type.description: Defines a rolling window function to apply, works along with the [Periods] text box

multiplier.label: Multiplier
multiplier.description: Factor to multiply the metric by

rolling_periods.label: Periods
rolling_periods.description: Defines the size of the rolling window function, relative to the time granularity selected

grid_size.label: Grid Size
grid_size.description: Defines the grid size in pixels

min_periods.label: Min Periods
min_periods.description: The minimum number of rolling periods required to show a value. For instance if you do a cumulative sum on 7 days you may want your "Min Period" to be 7, so that all data points shown are the total of 7 periods. This will hide the "ramp up" taking place over the first 7 periods

series.label: Series
series.description: Defines the grouping of entities. Each series is shown as a specific color on the chart and has a legend toggle

entity.label: Entity
entity.description: This defines the element to be plotted on the chart

url.label: URL
url.description: The URL, this control is templated, so you can integrate {{ width }} and/or {{ height }} in your URL string.

compare_lag.label: Comparison Period Lag
compare_lag.description: Based on granularity, number of time periods to compare against

compare_suffix.label: Comparison suffix
compare_suffix.description: Suffix to apply after the percentage display

page_length.label: Page Length
page_length.description: Rows per page, 0 means no pagination

rotation.label: Rotation
rotation.description: Rotation to apply to words in the cloud

line_interpolation.label: Line Style
line_interpolation.description: Line interpolation as defined by d3.js

pie_label_type.label: Label Type
pie_label_type.description: What should be shown on the label?

pandas_aggfunc.label: Aggregation function
pandas_aggfunc.description: Aggregate function to apply when pivoting and computing the total rows and columns

size_from.label: Font Size From
size_from.description: Font size for the smallest value in the list

size_to.label: Font Size To
size_to.description: Font size for the biggest value in the list

instant_filtering.label: Instant Filtering
instant_filtering.description: Whether to apply filters as they change, or wait forusers to hit an [Apply] button

show_brush.label: Range Filter
show_brush.description: Whether to display the time range interactive selector

date_filter.label: Date Filter
date_filter.description: Whether to include a time filter

show_sqla_time_granularity.label: Show SQL Granularity Dropdown
show_sqla_time_granularity.description: Check to include SQL Granularity dropdown

show_sqla_time_column.label: Show SQL Time Column
show_sqla_time_column.description: Check to include Time Column dropdown

show_druid_time_granularity.label: Show Druid Granularity Dropdown
show_druid_time_granularity.description: Check to include Druid Granularity dropdown

show_druid_time_origin.label: Show Druid Time Origin
show_druid_time_origin.description: Check to include Time Origin dropdown

show_datatable.label: Data Table
show_datatable.description: Whether to display the interactive data table

include_search.label: Search Box
include_search.description: Whether to include a client side search box

table_filter.label: Table Filter
table_filter.description: Whether to apply filter when table cell is clicked

align_pn.label: Align +/-
align_pn.description: Whether to align the background chart for +/- values

show_bubbles.label: Show Bubbles
show_bubbles.description: Whether to display bubbles on top of countries

show_values.label: Show Values
show_values.description: Whether to display the numerical values within the cells

x_axis_showminmax.label: X bounds
x_axis_showminmax.description: Whether to display the min and max values of the X-axis

y_axis_showminmax.label: Y bounds
y_axis_showminmax.description: Whether to display the min and max values of the Y-axis

rich_tooltip.label: Rich Tooltip
rich_tooltip.description: The rich tooltip shows a list of all series for that point in time

y_log_scale.label: Y Log Scale
y_log_scale.description: Use a log scale for the Y-axis

x_log_scale.label: X Log Scale
x_log_scale.description: Use a log scale for the X-axis

donut.label: Donut
donut.description: Do you want a donut or a pie?

labels_outside.label: Put labels outside
labels_outside.description: Put the labels outside the pie?

contribution.label: Contribution
contribution.description: Compute the contribution to the total

num_period_compare.label: Period Ratio
num_period_compare.description: [integer] Number of period to compare against, this is relative to the granularity selected

time_compare.label: Time Shift
time_compare.description: Overlay a timeseries from a relative time period. Expects relative time delta in natural language (example:  24 hours, 7 days, 56 weeks, 365 days)

subheader.label: Subheader
subheader.description: Description text that shows up below your Big Number

mapbox_label.label: label
mapbox_label.description: `count` is COUNT(*) if a group by is used. Numerical columns will be aggregated with the aggregator. Non-numerical columns will be used to label points. Leave empty to get a count of points in each cluster.

clustering_radius.label: Clustering Radius
clustering_radius.description: The radius (in pixels) the algorithm uses to define a cluster. Choose 0 to turn off clustering, but beware that a large number of points (>1000) will cause lag.

point_radius.label: Point Radius
point_radius.description: The radius of individual points (ones that are not in a cluster). Either a numerical column or `Auto`, which scales the point based on the largest cluster

point_radius_unit.label: Point Radius Unit
point_radius_unit.description: The unit of measure for the specified point radius

point_unit.label: Point Unit
point_unit.description: The unit of measure for the specified point radius

global_opacity.label: Opacity
global_opacity.description: Opacity of all clusters, points, and labels. Between 0 and 1.

viewport.label: Viewport
viewport.description: Parameters related to the view and perspective on the map

render_while_dragging.label: Live render
render_while_dragging.description: Points and clusters will update as viewport is being changed

mapbox_color.label: RGB Color
mapbox_color.description: The color for points and clusters in RGB

markers.label: Markers
markers.description: List of values to mark with triangles

marker_lines.label: Marker lines
marker_lines.description: List of values to mark with lines

slice_id.label: Slice ID
slice_id.description: The id of the active slice

cache_timeout.label: Cache Timeout (seconds)
cache_timeout.description: The number of seconds before expiring the cache

order_by_entity.label: Order by entity id
order_by_entity.description: Important! Select this if the table is not already sorted by entity id, else there is no guarantee that all events for each entity are returned.

min_leaf_node_event_count.label: Minimum leaf node event count
min_leaf_node_event_count.description: Leaf nodes that represent fewer than this number of events will be initially hidden in the visualization

color_scheme.label: Color Scheme
color_scheme.description: The color scheme for rendering chart

significance_level.label: Significance Level
significance_level.description: Threshold alpha level for determining significance

pvalue_precision.label: p-value precision
pvalue_precision.description: Number of decimal places with which to display p-values

liftvalue_precision.label: Lift percent precision
liftvalue_precision.description: Number of decimal places with which to display lift values

options.label: Aggregate Mean
options.description: Mean of values over specified period

options.label: Aggregate Sum
options.description: Sum of values over specified period

options.label: Difference
options.description: Metric change in value from `since` to `until`

options.label: Percent Change
options.description: Metric percent change in value from `since` to `until`

options.label: Advanced Analytics
options.description: Use the Advanced Analytics options below

equal_date_size.label: Equal Date Sizes
equal_date_size.description: Check to force date partitions to have the same height

partition_limit.label: Partition Limit
partition_limit.description: The maximum number of subdivisions of each group; lower values are pruned first

partition_threshold.label: Partition Threshold
partition_threshold.description: Partitions whose height to parent height proportions are below this value are pruned
